question_text: What is the likely consequence of installing non-matching memory modules in a dual-channel compatible motherboard?
answer_options: System will boot in safe mode only
Dual-channel functionality will be disabled, reverting to single-channel
BIOS will automatically synchronize the modules
System performance will double due to module diversity
correct_answer: Dual-channel functionality will be disabled, reverting to single-channel
explanation: To enable multi-channel memory configurations, the installed modules must match in speed, size, and type. Mismatched modules will cause the motherboard to fall back to single-channel mode.
